questions.question_text: Which statement is NOT correct when using Automatic Indexing on Autonomous Data Warehouse? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content: As per https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/autonomous-auto-index.html#GUID-D51A4F85-3AE5-4B7D-9B27-32CEDE8DBD79 - Auto Indexing is disabled by default in Autonomous Database. So, correct answer should be E.
question is "not true", Ans is E: cos indexing is disabled by default

Selected Answer: E
Is NOT enabled by default. The question is asking for the WRONG answer
D , Autoindex is disable by default, https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/autonomous-auto-index.html#GUID-D51A4F85-3AE5-4B7D-9B27-32CEDE8DBD79
E is the right answer. Remember the question asks what is NOT true? A is ture. E is not. Auto index is not enabled by defualt.

choices.B: You can control behavior at the statement level using the USE_AUTO_INDEXES or NO_USE_AUTO_INDEXES hints.
choices.C: You can use the DBMS_AUTO_INDEX package to report on the automatic task and to set your preferences.
choices.D: The indexing feature is implemented as an automatic task that runs at a fixed interval.
choices.A: Process includes identify candidates, create invisible auto indexes, verify with implement if performance improved and delete unused.

choices.C: All underlying data for OML notebooks is cloned.
choices.D: Current settings for ACLs are cloned.
choices.B: All resource management rules are cloned.
choices.E: Clone can be in a different region.

discussion.content: C,E are correct answer

Selected Answer: CD
--For a Metadata Clone, the APEX Apps and the OML Projects and Notebooks are copied to the clone. For a Metadata Clone, the underlying database data of the APEX App or OML Notebook is not cloned.
--If you create a clone and the source database has an access control list (ACL) and you specify the private endpoint network access option, Virtual cloud network for the target database, the ACL is not cloned to the new database

Selected Answer: DE
"When you select Clone from database instance as the clone source, and you choose another region, other than the current region for your clone target, you can only perform such a cross region clone using the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Console. Using either the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure CLI or Terraform is not supported for creating a cross-region clone."
Source: https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/autonomous-clone.html#GUID-68199DE6-CD45-4A6D-8EE6-1D95D45C8B1A
So E is correct
"If you define a network Access Control List (ACL) on the source database, the currently set network ACL is cloned to the new database. If a database is cloned from a backup, the current source database's ACL is applied (not the ACL that was valid of the time of the backup)."
Source: https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/autonomous-clone-notes.html#GUID-5F3BF5B4-BEE7-4ACD-86E5-D157F8ADA4EC
So D is also correct.
Answers: DE

Selected Answer: CD
Correct answer is C and D
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/autonomous-clone-notes.html#GUID-5F3BF5B4-BEE7-4ACD-86E5-D157F8ADA4EC

For a Metadata Clone, the APEX Apps and the OML Projects and Notebooks are copied to the clone. For a Metadata Clone, the underlying database data of the APEX App or OML Notebook is not cloned.

If you create a clone and the source database has an access control list (ACL) and you specify the private endpoint network access option, Virtual cloud network for the target database, the ACL is not cloned to the new database. 

Answer: C,D

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/autonomous-clone-notes.html#GUID-5F3BF5B4-BEE7-4ACD-86E5-D157F8ADA4EC

C,E coorect 
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/autonomous-clone-notes.html#GUID-F943E7FF-8DEB-47F4-84C0-FFA5BAF9D5A9
CD is the answer
C & E are right. Meta data only clone so no data. So obviously C is false. E is right as of now. But since it is new feature this question may be already obsolete.
C&E: For a Metadata Clone, the APEX Apps and the OML Projects and Notebooks are copied to the clone. For a Metadata Clone, the underlying database data of the APEX App or OML Notebook is not cloned.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are FALSE about creating a metadata-only clone with a private endpoint network access option? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Find the Service Console for your Autonomous Database, then pick Administration, then Download the Client Credentials (Wallet).
choices.D: Click on the Autonomous Data Warehouse section, pick a database, then Choose Actions, then Download the Wallet.
choices.C: Click on the Object Storage and find your Autonomous Bucket and Download the Wallet Credentials.
choices.E: Click on the Autonomous Data Warehouse in the menu, click a database name, then Choose DB Connection button, then Download the Wallet.
choices.A: Click the Compute section of the menu, then choose Instance Configurations, then Download Wallet.

questions.question_text: Which two are correct actions to take in order to Download the Autonomous Database Credentials? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Correct is BE. https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/connect-download-wallet.html#GUID-B06202D2-0597-41AA-9481-3B174F75D4B1

choices.C: Create a database user with connect, resource, and object privileges.
choices.B: Create a database user with the default privileges.
choices.A: Create an IDCS user. Create a database user with connect, resource, and object privileges.
choices.D: Create a database user (with connect, resource, object privileges), enable the schema to use SQL Developer and provide the user with the user-specific modified URL.

discussion.content:
D
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/connect-database-actions.html#GUID-4B404CE3-C832-4089-B37A-ADE1036C7EEA
D, https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/connect-database-actions.html#GUID-55BA432E-098A-48ED-B2EA-F2960A9EF586

questions.question_text:
You are the admin user of an Autonomous Database (ADB) instance. A new business analyst has joined the team and would like to explore ADB tables using
SQL Developer Web.
What steps do you need to take? (Choose the best answer.)
Which statement is true about connecting an OCI compute instance to a Shared Autonomous Database? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content: D is the most accurate answer. The use of private end point is entirely optional in always free, this rules out both A and B. If an instance has network connectivity, then it doesn't need to be on the same VCN, this rules out C. So if an instance has oracle client installed, then D is possible and most accurate.
I would agree with @brasi, D is the most accurate answer
A, https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Database/Concepts/adbsprivateaccess.htm

comments.content: I agree with your opinion, key point is connecting than what is DB.
B and C are wrong as it says "must" because are other options available to connect.

discussion.content:
Based on my studies, It should be C.

The question never said anything about free tier.
Also never said anything about private end point either. So,

https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Database/Concepts/adbsprivateaccess.htm

From the above link excerpt below.

"You can connect from a resource (like a compute instance) within the same VCN as the private endpoint. Note that you can also connect from a resource located in a different VCN from the private endpoint by using local or remote VCN peering."


Also,

If the compute is in same NSG it can connect too. Once again the question is not clear so we have to adjust to best guess.
correct answer is D

choices.B: The Autonomous Database must belong to a Network Security Group (NSG).
choices.E: The OCI compute instance does not support connecting to a Shared Autonomous Database.
choices.C: The Autonomous Database must be in the same VCN and Subnet as the Compute instance.
choices.A: A Private Endpoint is required to connect to the Shared-Autonomous Database.
choices.D: The OCI compute instance can be used with an Always-Free Autonomous Database account.
